snippet: New York state’s ethics commission should not grant blanket exemptions to political lobbying groups.
abstract: Editorial contends New York State ethics commission should not grant blanket exemptions to political lobbying groups, especially behind closed doors; holds vote to exempt Naral Pro-Choice New York from new ethics law requiring tax-exempt organizations to disclose their major donors should be reconsidered out in open; says commission has responsibility to the public under law to show exemptions will be rare and backed by undeniable evidence of actual threats to donors.
lead_paragraph: New York state’s ethics commission should not grant blanket exemptions to political lobbying groups.
